title: LC-MS data
text:
##On this page
##Experiment design
##Package Used
library(tidyverse)
library(tidymodels)

title: LC-MS data
text:
Loading Data

ID <- read.csv("csv/BOA Team Metabolomics Master Sample Decode.csv")
data <- read.csv("csv/MBL BoA Run 2 Neg.csv")
dataPos <- read.csv("csv/MBL BoA Run 2 Pos.csv")

#split planaria data from the scan
pladata <- data %>% 
  select(compound, any_of(ID$sampleId))

pladataPos <- dataPos %>% 
  select(compound, any_of(ID$sampleId))

colnames(pladata)

 [1] "compound" "H1"       "H2"       "H3"       "H4"       "H5"      
 [7] "H6"       "H7"       "H8"       "H9"       "H10"      "H11"     
[13] "H12"     

dim(pladata)

[1] 332  13

plaData <- rbind(pladata, pladataPos)
plaData$compound <- make.unique(plaData$compound)

dim(plaData)

[1] 497  13

plaDataLong <- pivot_longer(plaData,cols = c(2:13), names_to = "sampleId", values_to = "IC")

plaDataLong <- merge(plaDataLong, ID, by = "sampleId")

dim(plaDataLong)

[1] 5964    5

colnames(plaDataLong)

[1] "sampleId" "compound" "IC"       "organism" "time"    

table(plaDataLong$time)


  0h  24h  48h   6h 
1491 1491 1491 1491

title: LC-MS data
text:
Prep the Data

#set a seed in order to make the analysis reproducible
set.seed(11)

# change into wide
plaDataWide <- plaDataLong %>%
  pivot_wider(
    id_cols = c(sampleId, organism, time), 
    names_from = compound,
    values_from = IC)

pca_recipe <- recipe(~ ., data = plaDataWide) %>%
  update_role(sampleId, organism, time, new_role = "id")

summary(pca_recipe)

# A tibble: 500 × 4
   variable                type      role      source  
   <chr>                   <list>    <chr>     <chr>   
 1 sampleId                <chr [3]> id        original
 2 organism                <chr [3]> id        original
 3 time                    <chr [3]> id        original
 4 Lys-Gly                 <chr [2]> predictor original
 5 Indolelactic acid       <chr [2]> predictor original
 6 4-Methylene-glutamine   <chr [2]> predictor original
 7 LysoPC(20:0)            <chr [2]> predictor original
 8 PE(38:3)                <chr [2]> predictor original
 9 N-Acetylneuraminic acid <chr [2]> predictor original
10 Glycerol 3-phosphate    <chr [2]> predictor original
# ℹ 490 more rows

pca_recipe <- recipe(~ ., data = plaDataWide) %>%
  update_role(sampleId, organism, time, new_role = "id") %>% 
  step_scale(all_predictors()) %>%  
  step_center(all_predictors()) %>%
  step_pca(all_predictors(), id = "pca")

pca_recipe




── Recipe ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────





── Inputs 


Number of variables by role


predictor: 497
id:          3





── Operations 


• Scaling for: all_predictors()


• Centering for: all_predictors()


• PCA extraction with: all_predictors()

# 4. recipe 적용
pca_prepped <- prep(pca_recipe)

Warning: !  The following columns have zero variance so scaling cannot be used:
  carnitine C26:0, GDP-glucose, 3-Hydroxyhexadecanoylcarnitine, Trehalose
  6-phosphate.1, carnitine C30:0, hydroxyicosanoic acid,
  sphingosylphosphorylcholine, Taurodeoxycholic acid, Tridecanoyl carnitine,
  Cortisol, UDP-D-Xylose, octenoylcarnitine, Glutamylcysteine,
  De-O-methylsterigmatocystin, decadienoylcarnitine, shikimate-3-phosphate,
  5-L-Glutamyl-taurine, Leu-Val, …, dodecenoylcarnitine, and
  (2S)-5-Amino-2-[(2-methoxy-2-oxoethyl)sulfonylamino]-5-oxopentanoic acid.
ℹ Consider using ?step_zv (`?recipes::step_zv()`) to remove those columns
  before normalizing.

pca_prepped




── Recipe ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────





── Inputs 


Number of variables by role


predictor: 497
id:          3





── Training information 


Training data contained 12 data points and no incomplete rows.





── Operations 


• Scaling for: Lys-Gly Indolelactic acid, ... | Trained


• Centering for: Lys-Gly Indolelactic acid, ... | Trained


• PCA extraction with: Lys-Gly Indolelactic acid, ... | Trained

pca_baked <- bake(pca_prepped, plaDataWide)
pca_baked

# A tibble: 12 × 8
   sampleId organism time       PC1    PC2      PC3   PC4     PC5
   <chr>    <chr>    <chr>    <dbl>  <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
 1 H1       Planaria 48h   -12.1    -5.59  -10.4    -3.27 -3.94  
 2 H10      Planaria 0h      9.89   -5.25    0.791  -3.62 10.4   
 3 H11      Planaria 0h     29.1     5.26   -1.17    3.92 -6.16  
 4 H12      Planaria 0h     -0.0141 -4.93   11.9    -9.59 -8.38  
 5 H2       Planaria 48h   -14.6    -2.58   -4.47   -2.69 -1.35  
 6 H3       Planaria 48h   -10.1    23.2    -1.21   -1.99 -0.0971
 7 H4       Planaria 24h   -12.1    -1.16   13.4     9.50  1.43  
 8 H5       Planaria 24h    -0.583  -6.20   -5.86   11.9  -3.77  
 9 H6       Planaria 24h    -7.35   -2.38   -0.0663  1.83  2.68  
10 H7       Planaria 6h      5.30    2.70    0.333   3.12  3.34  
11 H8       Planaria 6h      7.31   -2.16   -2.03   -5.17 -2.86  
12 H9       Planaria 6h      5.26   -0.919  -1.21   -3.92  8.70  

ggplot(pca_baked, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = time)) +
  geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.8) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "PCA of LC-MS IC values", x = "PC1", y = "PC2")







ggplot(pca_baked, aes(x = PC1, y = PC3, color = time, label = sampleId)) +
  geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.8) +
  geom_text(check_overlap = TRUE, color = "black") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "PCA of LC-MS IC values", x = "PC1", y = "PC3")
